text: If people are selling elote out of the trunks of their cars nearby, you know the tacos are going to be awesome. Apparently this is THE place to eat on Sunday mornings and it's well deserved. I felt like I was home in Brooklyn. Delicioso!

This is the proverbial "hole in the wall" place.

If you have a sense of adventure, this is a good place to try. The broth and the barbacoa by the pound are their main staples, one pound should feed a couple just fine. The barbacoa by the pound comes with freshly made tortillas. They have tacos and other Mexican foods too.

If you are not sure about what barbacoa is, Wikipedia has a good enough entry.
Great place to eat. The food is delicious and the staff are really friendly. It's not a fancy place like other establishments but it has a little ole Mexico to it. Love it and highly recommend it.

Omg I've lived across the street from this place and am so upset that I never stopped by. Best tacos I've had in town so far.... Everything we ordered was great... Even my kids (who can be picky) loved it here. This is a hole in the wall place you can't go without trying... You won't be disappointed. Handmade tortillas..... And great service

holy cow!!!! 

The first time I came here I was not able to eat the food because they had closed early and I was so sad. 

the next time I was driving by and saw they were open, quickly we came in and ordered 2 barbacoa plates with consume (broth). This place is amazing, incredible and fresh. I will be back! I have been searching for a place close to the mexican food in LA and this place is as close as it can get if not better. 

They have the oil chili sauce, I had never had and I am addicted. Since leaving I have been craving it and want to come back. I will be back!!!!

Love this place!!!  This is the mom and pop hole in the wall taco place.  Their tortillas are homemade and always so fresh,  so good! The family runs the place and they are always so nice, it's not only the food but the service that keeps us coming back. Highly recommend!!!

I had an urge for barbocoa and was only .2 miles from This location.
The tortillas are home made/ hand made fresh that's why I gave it the 4 stars. 
I had the consum√©, it was okay nothing to rave about.  The barbocoa was ok too; it was kinda bland.   I had to add a lot of condiments like salsa, onion, cilantro etc 
The decor is Mexican style of course nothing fancy or anything that appeals to ones eyes.

Another mom and pops in Las Vegas that I've been to year after Year.....friendliest service and the food is amazing!!!! Expect great friendly service,very clean and prices are very reasonable....when in Vegas this place is a must...
Let me just say awesome ! People are great food is even better . The consome is a must . Will be back forsure time and time again . This take me over half hour to get to and I will be back often !
Love this place. Best Barbacoa in town!!! Great service and great food!! Chicken burritos are awesome! I love those fresh salsa and condiments. Fresh chips and great tacos!
Love this place! Food is always delicious!! Hard to find a good Mexican place here in Vegas with real Mexican flavor and this place is one of the lucky places I found . Service is awesome too.

Awesome ambiance, hole-in-the wall taco shop. The tortillas are hand pressed fresh for each order and are amazing, light and have a perfect chew. 

I tried several meats, all were very good. Very friendly service.

Everything here is so fresh! I've tried the plates, tacos, quesadilla, soups, almost every item in the place. I don't have one memory of any of them being less than delicious. It's a family owned business and you can tell they are very hands on.

My usual dish is the tripe tacos. They're crispy, fatty and oh so yummy. The tortillas are hand made, so they have this amazing chew to it. My second go to are the soups. They're flavorful and contain a lot of meat. If you're not sure about which to choose they give out samples. . 

Place is very clean, service is great and food is bomb. That's it.

Excellente comida. Barbacoa de Borrego deliciosa, junto con tortillas de mano y rico consome. Todo se ve muy rico. Salsas picositas. Excellent food and service.  From California definitely will come back.
Bomb.com my kids are picky when it comes to any Mexican food outside from home and they left nothing on their plates very satisfied. Will be going back soon

The barbacoa combination plate was AMAZING i also got consome on the side that i added to my meat along with salsa de aceite and cilantro and onion the tortillas are handmade super thick and gave us plenty !! The hot sauces are also really good !!! My number one place is vegas for barbacoa Now !!!

La barbacoa plato de combination bien rico me encanto tambien el consome con arrozito adentro muy delicioso las salsas muy ricas y tambien tienen salsa de aceite las tortillas a mano que los dieron estaban deliciosas y gorditas definitiva mente vamos a regresar todo estuvo al 100%
Check out the picture i posted its the plate of barbaco with rice and been

Called before to ask if they had elote, said yes, drove out only to find they didnt. Then when he over charged us, he said his menu was old and they raised the prices. The food wasn't anything special either. Should have stayed home.

I came here since it's not too far from home and decided to try something new . Going in it smells like you're walking into a mechanic shop. I figured this is because of the scooter repair shop next door. I went to order my food which was 2 huaraches 2 drinks and 1 horchata. My total was $36. This seemed pretty pricey compared to other local mexican restaurants. When I asked for a receipt to see how much was each thing he just wrote the items I ordered and the total on the bottom. He didn't want to write each price per item. Turns out the huaraches are $12 each not $10. When I finally got my order the food didn't really have flavor and was cute up taco meat instead of the thin steak these are known for. It had so little meat and all together the food didn't have a good flavor . I won't be coming here again.

A couple of weeks ago I had the misfortune to dine at a trendy modern Latin/fusion restaurant miles from here and they served something they passed off as barbacoa (it was more like mop strands soaked in mild chili sauce) the barbacoa I grew up with was done with beef cheeks and/or the meat from the head braised then flash grilled to add some crispy bits. You haven't lived till you come home from school and find a whole cow's head is staring at you from the fridge. Today I set out to find decent barbacoa.

This place is about barbacoa and straight up real Mexican comfort food. The barbacoa is done Hidalgo style using lamb instead of beef. I sampled two barbacoa tacos, beans, and the salsa bar. The Barbacoa was the best I've had since my childhood. It was rich, dense, and succulent. I went over board with the great tasting condiments but the barbacoa was unmistakably excellent.  The decor is spartan, clean, and a telanovela is usually playing on the mounted TV.  But you don't come to places like this to ponder ambiance and art work, you come for the real deal.

I went with my family because they told us that the barbacoa was amazing well they are right about the name "Barbacoa Kings" we had the consome every bite was packed with flavor !!! Takes me back to my childhood when I went to go visit Mexico for the first time. it was the most amazing thing I have ever tried.! We also ordered a burrito de Asada the meat was so tender and was perfect usually when I try Asada anywhere else the meat is hard and dry but nope NOT here ! Salsa's were amazing and spicy ! 
Worth coming back again for sure!

The meats are really very, very good.   The barbacoa,  and Michoacan-style pork were very tasty - - in isolation.    Maybe getting meats by the pound is the way to go, as one Yelper suggested.

But the low score is for the tacos I had.   Again, the meats were good;  the salsas were also good;  the tortillas were light and fresh.  It's just that, these were not very good tacos.  The flavors do not match, and they do not blend into a satisfying product.   I think the main problem are the tortillas - - they have a simplicity and a sweetness, but the flavors do not match the meats, nor the salsas.  These tacos were not a well conceived whole, from a flavor perspective, and they were not that enjoyable to eat.

Really caring service though.

We were hungry and had a hankering for traditional Mexican food and happened upon this restaurant. Right off we were greeted by friendly staff. They were efficient as well. Not knowing some of the menu items we chose tacos. An excellent choice, chicken was cooked with very unique spices and tender. We tried 2 types of pork and both were tasty. The soft tortillas had a find flavor and texture. The beans brought back good memories. So, the food they are known for must be fantastic. Enjoy
